intro: Doliocarpus lasiogyne, commonly known as the rough-leaved doliocarpus, is a species of flowering plant in the family Anacardiaceae. It is characterized by its compound leaves with serrated margins and small, clustered yellow flowers. The plant produces berries that are typically dark red when mature, containing several seeds. It is native to tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil and Peru. Doliocarpus lasiogyne is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and along stream banks.
